subject: Re: [junit] assertEquals(File source, File target) ?
msgSnippet: ... I love Vladimir, but I dislike this API. Files are equal if they represent the same physical file on disk, so assertEquals(File, File) should not be
messageBody:
Brian Button wrote:
> ianatyahoo@... wrote:
> >
> >
> > Is there a
> >
> > boolean assertEquals( f1, f2 ) where the contents
> >
> > are compared and evaluated ?
> > It's easy enough to write one but I'd rather reuse than
> > re-invent.
>
> Have a peek at junit-addons.
>
> http://sourceforge.net/projects/junit-addons

I love Vladimir, but I dislike this API. Files are equal if they
represent the same physical file on disk, so assertEquals(File, File)
should not be comparing content. It's not clear from the Javadoc whether
FileAssert is doing that. One has to browse the tests to find that out.
That's not necessarily bad, but typically assertEquals() uses equals()
directly, so when it /doesn't/, I wouldn't call it assertEquals().

That said, I would just use JUnit-addons, rather than Diasparsoft
Toolkit, for this specific case.

Take care.
